results.purpose: Pet food subscription pricing strategy and model for The Pets Table (TPT), defining pricing principles, methodology, and competitive positioning across different product plans (Fresh, Mixed, Topper, Dry, Air Dried)
key_data_points: Max freezer fill: 1/3 of small NYC apartment freezer
Fresh plan: Match TFD (The Farmer's Dog) prices excluding shipping
Mixed plan: 5-15% below Fresh depending on size and margins
Topper plan: 55-62.5% of Fresh price for 50% of product
Dry plan: Lowest price at 38% margins
PC2 (Profit Contribution 2) margins tracked across plans
ROI optimization for larger dogs prioritized

entities.name: The Pets Table (TPT)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service with multiple product plans being priced

entities.name: The Farmer's Dog (TFD)
entities.context: Primary competitor benchmark for Fresh plan pricing

entities.name: Ollie
entities.context: Competitor mentioned for Fresh plan pricing comparison

entities.name: Fresh Plan
entities.context: Headline pricing tier, benchmarked against TFD

entities.name: Topper Plan
entities.context: Partial feeding option at 55-62.5% of Fresh price

entities.name: Dry/Air Dried Plan
entities.context: Lowest price point to increase TAM (Total Addressable Market)

entities.name: Pantry Fresh
entities.context: Referenced as positioning consideration for Mixed plan

insights: Pricing strategy follows a 6-step methodology: import costs → benchmark competitors → create scenarios → smooth pricing → check margins → create stepped pricing
Architecture principle: same quantity of food must always have same price across SKUs
Price per pound should decrease as calories increase within same plan
Strategic focus on encouraging larger dog subscriptions due to higher ROI
Shipping is charged separately but free on first order to reduce acquisition friction
Price testing priorities include: lowering Air Dried for broader market entry, increasing Fresh competitiveness, and optimizing Mixed plan positioning
Margin optimization (PC2) is balanced against competitive pricing pressure from TFD and Ollie
Trial pricing matches regular box pricing before discounts to maintain perceived value
Pricing must account for NYC apartment freezer constraints (physical product limitation)
